sub_title: former owner of Meer Mens advice and training
summary:
With an educational background of Accountancy and Theology (both focussing on accountability!) I worked for 22 years as programme officer with ICCO (www.icco.nl) and since October 2004 for myself as freelance consultant.
In my consultancy life and advices I aim to translate the lessons learned during my many contacts with people in overseas NGO's and CBO's. What I am offering is analysis and advice on Sustainable Organisational Development, both from an objective point of view (based on actual MDF theory) and a subjective point of view (based on my large experience, knowledge, life skills and intuition). 
Via my work and advices I want to contribute to a better functioning of organisations as carriers of programmes aiming to benefit the living cirumstances of people in need. 
Are you interested? Please see my CV. I send it on request (aadenteunivandermeer@gmail.com) or call 0031(0)651043060. Let's cooperate!

Specialties: Sustainable Organisational Development, assessing the quality of the work of organisations, bringing out very practical hands on reports, a professional frank and open approach with understanding and acceptance of cultural differences. 
Geographical focus --> Southern Africa, East Africa, Indian subcontinent

One e-mail to info@meermens.org and you will receive the prospectus and more relevant information. Would love to link up with you. not as Meer Mens owner this time but in as private person. Don't hesitate!.

company.name: Stichting Zulu Aid (for Hillcrest Aids Centre in South Africa)

volunteer_experiences.description:
With six other active people I form the board of Stichting Zulu Aid (Zulu Aid Foundation) www.zuluaid.nl. Zulu Aid is the Dutch representative of the HIV and AIDS organisation Hillcrest Aids Centre in the Valley of Thousand Hills, close to Durban, KZN, South Africa. 
My role is boardmember fundraising doing fundraising and promotion work. 
Hillcrest Aids Centre is active on the entire spectrum of HIV and AIDS interventions (from education, prevention, testing, nutrition, economic empowerment to a Respite Unit/hospice.Hillcrest Aids Centre is active on facebook. Their website is www.hillaids.org.za.  
Stichting Zulu Aid is growing in a sustainable way and supported by churches, private persons, schools and development organisations. We are ANBI and as per july 2018 we received the CBF certificate. Don't hesitate to contact us on info@zuluaid.nl. 
.

CINI Holland is the Dutch representative of CINI India, the experienced and successful mother and child care organisation, active in and around the crowded city Kolkata in West Bengal.
CINI Holland tries to motivate people in The Netherlands to support CINI India. Seven times I organised for CINI Holland educational trips for midwives and maternal nurses. 
CINI Holland can be found on website www.ciniholland.nl. Contact them, it is worthwhile!
